biography:
Jen Thomas is a designer, book artist, printmaker, educator, and writer based in Chicago, Illinois. She earned her B.F.A. in Communication Arts from Virginia Commonwealth University; studied printmaking at Plymouth University, Exeter, England; and completed her M.F.A. in Interdisciplinary Book & Paper Arts at Columbia College Chicago. She also spent a year working with master printers Jack Lemon and Steve Campbell at Landfall Press and continues to edition under her own imprint Veronica Press. In the spring of 2005 she received a studio fellowship at Women’s Studio Workshop to complete a series of artist’s books of short fiction, in addition to assisting Audrey Niffenegger’s Intaglio class at Penland School of Crafts. In 2006 Jen was a visiting artist at Ohio State University in Columbus, Ohio, and Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia, as well as Columbia College Chicago and Chicago-based arts center Marwen. 

In 2012, Jen founded werkspace, a gallery and community arts space dedicated to showcasing the work of emerging artists, while also offering community arts workshops. Jen’s sculptural board games, artist’s books, prints, and drawings have been exhibited nationally and have won several awards. When she’s not drawing medical anomalies and taxidermied animals on handmade paper, she spends her time tinkering with open source software and designing her next indie board game/artist book. Jen teaches graphic design and illustration at DePaul University, the Illinois Institute of Art, and the Chicago High School for the Arts, while also running werkspace.
